intro: Dolicholus americanus, commonly known as the American dolicholus, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and somewhat woody. The plant is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as swamps and along riverbanks.
